lines.line: Ahoy, young. Might ye be able to help me, perhaps? I be in a spot of bother.
Who are you?
I be the Corsair Captain! Captain of the Corsairs of Corsair Cove! My gallant band of corsairs are famed in song and story among all seafarers.
I've never heard of you.
Arrr... well, ye can boast of yer ignorance if ye likes, but it don't make ye sound smarter.
Well, as I were saying, young, I be in a spot of bother, and I thought ye might be able to help.
That's very interesting; do tell me more.
What kind of help do you need?
It be about my crew. They be a lazy bunch at times, but they be stout in the heart and strong in the arm, and they don't deserve what's happened to them...
It be a curse! A curse has been laid upon my crew! That's the only thing it can be.
So I need a young such as yerself to find a way to lift the curse. Will ye help me?
Sure, I'll try to help with your curse.
Arrr! Thanks, young. And a worthy ye must surely be, brave in the heart and stiff in the spine.
Now, I've a ship moored west of Rimmington. Come and meet me on board, and we'll set off to Corsair Cove.
West of Rimmington, you say? Okay, I'll meet you on board your ship there.
No, I'm not available.
Arrr. Some other time, perhaps...
Arrr, ye've found my ship - good. I used to command a much larger vessel, sailing the seas with my crew of Corsairs, but now we be settled in Corsair Cove.
My Corsairs be a good crew, but this curse has laid them low, all except me. Sickly, they be. Too weak to stand. Ye'll see fer yerself soon enough.
There be four of 'em afflicted by the curse - Gnocci, Ithoi, Arsen and young Colin. All taken to their beds, a- mewlin' and a-pukin' like so many babbies.
I've another crewman, Francois, but he be away on a mission. I hope he be spared!
Now be ye ready to voyage to Corsair Cove to help 'em? I can sail ye back here any time ye likes.
Okay, I'm ready go to Corsair Cove.
Not just now, thanks.
That's fair enough, young, but perhaps ye'll return to help me soon...
Urgh!
I hear you've been cursed.
I think so. That navigator, Ithoi, always warned us that this kind of thing could happen, but I didn't think it could possibly be real. But now this has happened, and I think it's my fault.
You should maybe see what Ithoi thinks. He's been cursed too, so I guess he'll be in his hut, off to the south-west, near the shore.
Urgh to you too, with candy sprinkles on.
A sympathetic soul you are. I'm in real pain here.
Yes, I hear you've been cursed.
I'm sorry! Tell her I'm sorry! Then maybe she'll make the pain stop...
Yes, that's what it must be. Ithoi, the navigator, always told us to beware of curses. You should talk to him - he really knows about these things.
Ithoi lives in the hut to the south-west, nearest to the sea.
Perhaps you can tell me about it another time.
I'll be here. I'm not going anywhere while I feel so sick.
My stomach!
Yes, I think She did this to us. I should have left Her alone. Ithoi told us to beware of this kind of thing.
Ithoi's been cursed too. You can probably find him in his hut, south-west from here.
My lower intestine!
... look, I'm in a lot of pain here. We're not playing Name Your Favourite Body Part.
Arrr, we be cursed, we be CURSED! It be a curse upon us!
Aye? D'ye think so? Really? Am I not a picture of health an' beauty?
YES - WE'VE BEEN CURSED!
I've sailed the seas all my life. I sailed the seas as a man, like I sailed 'em as a boy.
I even sailed the seas during that tricky phase in between, when ye'r not quite a man yet, but ye'r not really a boy anymore. But I don't want to talk about that bit.
Um...
The point I'm makin' is that I know the seas like I know the palm of my hand. I've been to strange lands an' seen things that'll make yer juices turn in yer veins.
I've seen dancing fish-women, monkey-kings, huge men in turbans from the far West selling treasure maps - you name it, an' I've seen it.
There be more things in the world than ye dreams of in yer fancy book-learnin'! An' most of 'em be hostile. Could be any number of things brought this curse upon us. Demons, evil spirits, anything!
Okay, it doesn't sound like you know what's behind the curse. Thanks.
Arrr!
I think I'll leave you to get on with it.
... arrr.
Have ye any idea about how to lift the curse?
I've spoken to some of your crew.
Arrr! Make sure ye speaks to 'em all. They'll be in their huts, over to the west. Four of them, there are - Gnocci, Ithoi, Arsen and young Colin.
I think so. That navigator, Ithoi, always warned us that this kind of thing could happen.
I've met him. He definitely thinks it's a curse, but wasn't able to say exactly what caused it.
I'm afraid it may be all my fault.
Oh?
Captain Tock had me exploring some caves, west of the cove. I'm a thief, see, like my brother Francois, and the Captain thought I could sneak past the monsters without being noticed.
Well, I climbed down the vines, and found a big cave filled with terrifying ogres!
I'd hoped I could use my amazing Thieving skills to avoid them seeing me, but I was out of luck. By the time I'd finished clambering down the ladder, they'd spotted me.
So you were trying to explore that ogre cave, and the ogres saw you?
Yes. I quickly grabbed some loot, so I wouldn't have to face the Captain empty-handed, and fled up the ladder before the ogres could kill me!
But a couple of days later we all fell ill. I think what I stole must have been some kind of sacred relic, and the shamans in the cave have cursed us for stealing it.
Maybe you could get the relic back from the Captain, and return it to the ogres? And tell them I'm very sorry. Then perhaps they'll lift the curse.
I see.
Have you got that relic back from Captain Tock? Maybe if you return it to the ogres, they'll lift the curse.
Nope, I've not done that.
Oh dear.
Please take it back to the ogres for me, and tell them I'm sorry.
Arsen says he gave you a sacred ogre relic.
Arrr, that he did. I'd sent him to explore the caves west of the cove, an' he brings me back a bone lump, saying he stole it from the ogre chief.
He thinks the ogres have cursed you all because he stole one of their sacred relics, and he wants me to take it back to them now.
Arrr, I've no use fer the silly thing. If it'll get the curse lifted, ye can take it right to that ogre chief an' give it back.
What you want, skinny creature?
A man called Arsen told me he'd visited your cave.
Yah, skinny man climb down vine the other day. Little man, big idiot! Hahahaha...
He says he's very sorry...
He very silly!
Perhaps I should come back another time.
I've come to return what Arsen stole.
Arsen says he's very sorry for stealing from you. Here it is...
Yah, dat little man is big idiot. Climbed down vine, grabbed tooth-pick off Tess and ran away like scared kebbit.
You're saying this is a tooth-pick? Not a sacred relic of the ogres? Did your shamans curse the Corsairs for stealing it?
Dis is tooth-pick. Tess got plenty more. If skinny idiot man want Tess' old tooth-pick, maybe he sick in his head. But Tess not having shamans curse anyone.
Oh. Well, I guess Arsen will be pleased to hear he didn't bring the curse upon the Corsairs.
Have you returned the sacred relic to the ogres? Will they forgive me and lift the curse?
Their chief, Tess, says that wasn't a sacred relic at all. It was her tooth-pick.
Are you telling me the ogres cursed us all because I stole their chief's tooth-pick?
She didn't care - she's got lots of tooth-picks, and she just thought you were some kind of weirdo when you stole one. They never cursed you at all.
Oh. That's a relief, I guess. Um... thank you for your help. But I do wonder where the curse really came from.
I'm not done investigating yet.
Yes, that's what it must be. Ithoi, the navigator, always told us to beware of curses.
This is all my fault. But I didn't mean to upset her. I just thought we could be friends. Now I must have upset her, and she's cursed us all!
Ithoi always told us that bad things happen to sailors who get involved with mermaids, but I didn't believe him. I should have listened! But I'll tell you what happened...
I was using Ithoi's telescope...
Such a beautiful night!
What lands lie beyond the dim horizon, I wonder...
Eh?
What was that? I'd better have another look.
Is that what I think it is?
It's so dark out there, but I think...... yes, I'm quite sure...
... yes, it's a mermaid! She's beautiful!
Hello?
Can you hear me?
You're the most lovely person I've ever seen!
I can see you moving your arms, but it's very dark. Are you waving to me?
*kiss*
Oh, no, I think she's gone away. Did I put her off?
Maybe she doesn't like strangers shouting about her appearance and blowing kisses at her. That might have been rude of me.
I hope she's not angry. Ithoi says mermaids can be dangerous.
Perhaps you can find the mermaid and tell her I'm very sorry I was rude to her. Then maybe she'll lift the curse.
Have you found the mermaid yet? Will she forgive me?
Where did you find this mermaid?
I was using Ithoi's telescope to look out at the sea, imagining the strange lands and fantastic creatures Ithoi's always telling us he's seen, and I saw her.
Nope, I've not seen any mermaids round here.
Oh dear, oh dear. Maybe we'll be cursed forever!
Let's see if I can find that mermaid he saw...
That doesn't look anything like a mermaid. That's an ogre!
That doesn't look anything like a mermaid. That's Bugs, the son of that chompy hunter, Rantz!
I've seen enough of that ogre already. Colin might be relieved to hear it wasn't a mermaid.
I've looked through that telescope myself. That wasn't a mermaid. That was a wet ogre.
He's definitely not a mermaid.
I've met that ogre before. He lives with his dad in the Feldip Hills. He's definitely not a mermaid.
Oh. Oh, I see. Okay... I guess that means I didn't upset a mermaid after all. So the curse isn't my fault! Thank you!
How are you feeling?
I still feel awful. But I'm glad you've proven it wasn't my fault that we got cursed. I hope you can work out what brought it on us.
I'll be on the case.
It's all my fault, I know it is. I've awoken Her, and now She's done this to us!
Who are you talking about?
I'll explain... See, I'm the cook, and I have to find the food as well as cooking it...
I was fishing...
Let's see what I can find for the boys tonight.
C'mon little lobsters, come to Gnocci!
Obby-lobby obby-lobby oi oi oi!
'obby-lobby' - what?
It's a traditional lobster-fishing chant handed down by my ancestors. Don't interrupt.
C'mon little lobsters. We don't want to keep the Captain waiting! He'll get angry with me again.
Ooh, what's this? This isn't a lobster.
Looks more like a child's toy. But - no, it can't be...
Is it moving?
She's moving! SHE'S POSSESSED! HELP!
I buried Her in the sand, by that tree, to the west. But I still feel Her eyes staring into my soul. Please find Her, and kill the demon inside!
Have you tried to destroy Her yet? Her eyes, those terrible eyes!
Where did you say this happened?
On the beach, to the west of the cove. Near a big tree. I buried Her in the sand, but I can still feel her eyes staring into my soul. Please find Her, and kill the demon inside!
No, I've not.
Oh dear, I feel terrible. Please help us soon.
Okay, he said he buried the possessed doll in the sand...
That's not possessed. That sounds more like clockwork.
That's not possessed. That sounds more like clockwork. In fact I've got the Crafting level to make those.
Actually, it sounds scary.
Well, sort of. That doll wasn't possessed at all. It was a clockwork toy. They're supposed to move.
Clockwork? Oh, that would explain how it moved. Ahem. Well, I suppose the curse didn't come from Her.
I hope you can find the real cause soon.
Still trying.
Ye be back? Tell me, do those scurvy Corsairs take the curse seriously?
I've been hearing about what might have caused it...
Colin thought he upset a mermaid, and she might have cursed you all in revenge.
Arrr! That'll teach him to meddle with such folk. Colin should stick to what he's good at.
Gnocci fished a doll out of the water, and he thought it might have been possessed by an evil spirit.
Arrr chuckie chuckie chuckie! That'll teach him to play with dolls at his age. Dolls can be frightening.
Arsen stole what he thought was a sacred relic from the ogre cave, and he said their shamans might have cursed you in revenge.
Arrr! Ogre women be powerful, an' Arsen be a fool.
I'll carry on trying to solve the curse.
Arrr! Off ye goes...
They all have different theories about the curse.
Arrr, that be likely enough. Ithoi tells me there be many things in this world that can bring a curse upon an unwary seafarer.
Ye can maybe solve the problem fer each victim, an' see if it lifts the curse.
I've ruled out all the Corsairs' theories...
Cabin-boy Colin thought he'd upset a mermaid, but there wasn't a mermaid, just a wet ogre.
Arsen the Thief thought he'd upset the ogre shamans by stealing a sacred ogre relic, but it was just a tooth-pick, and the ogres didn't care.
Ithoi the Navigator said there were lots of things that could bring a curse on a crew, and this could be any of them.
And Gnocci the Cook thought he'd awoken a demon in a possessed doll, but it wasn't possessed at all. It was clockwork.
Arrr, any sufficiently advanced technology be indistinguishable from demonic possession, that it be.
So what do I do now?

Arrr, I don't rightly know. It began when I'd gone away for a parlay with Ithoi; we came back ter find the crew all a-pukin' up their dinner. Then Ithoi felt ill too, though he'd not eaten with 'em, so it can't be the food.
I see. You're saying it began after they'd all eaten, but Ithoi felt ill even though he'd not had any of the food.
Arrr, that be right.
That meal must have been interesting...
Can I give up and go home?
If ye wants a ride back to Rimmington, I'll take ye there any time, but I do hope ye can help my poor crew.
You said it began after they'd all eaten.
Arrr. I'd gone away for a parlay with Ithoi; we came back ter find the crew all a-pukin' up their dinner. Then Ithoi felt ill too, though he'd not eaten with 'em, so it can't be the food.
Ye be back? Have ye been investigatin' the curse?
I hear it happened straight after dinner.
Arrr! That be wrong! I were away for a parlay with Captain Tock, an' I didn't eat that dinner at all. The Captain can tell ye so himself.
So it must be a curse. A CURSE!
Okay, thanks.
I'm still looking into it.
Have you solved the curse yet?
Hey, don't go blaming the cook just because the curse began after dinner. I didn't even cook that meal. I'd been too scared of the possessed doll...
You mean the clockwork doll?
It's an easy mistake to make!
Anyway I didn't dare try to fish after that, and Ithoi volunteered to do all the fishing and cooking instead, before he went off for his parlay with Captain Tock.
Anyway, Ithoi got sick without even eating it, so it can't be the food.
I hear the Captain's thinking of firing Ithoi.
I don't see why that's got anything to do with the curse.
Perhaps not.
So you say Ithoi prepared that meal?
Yes, he volunteered to do all the fishing and cooking for me, even though he knew he'd miss dinner for his parlay with Captain Tock. Ithoi's a good soul.
Have you found out how we all got cursed?
That's right. Gnocci had cooked us some swordfish. It didn't taste as good as his usual cooking, but I didn't complain. The Captain doesn't like complainers.
Then we all started feeling sick and clammy. That was when the Captain and Ithoi came back from their parlay, and Ithoi looked sick too.
Well, I suppose we don't need a navigator these days, and he's not very good at anything else. But I don't see why that's got anything to do with the curse.
Do you know how we all got cursed?
I hear Ithoi cooked the meal you ate that night.
I suppose Ithoi's trying to be extra helpful at the moment. Don't tell anyone, but Ithoi might not be in our crew much longer.

My brother, Francois, says the Captain will make him second-in-command if he completes his mission. That's Ithoi's rank, but we don't need a navigator now we've settled here, and he can't do much else.
What is the mission Francois is doing?
That's a secret.
I hear you're thinking of firing Ithoi.
Arrr, maybe I am, but I'm sure that be nothing to do wi' the curse. Ithoi's afflicted by it too.
I hear you cooked the meal they ate before getting sick.
Arrr? And what if I did? Can't an old sailor help his crew without interfering young land-lubbers making accusations?
Maybe because the Captain's thinking of firing you - Arsen heard it from his brother. The Corsairs don't need a navigator anymore.

Arrr! Too clever ye be... I heard the Captain might kick me off the crew, so I poisoned the dinner, an' acted sick too. Now they think they're cursed, so they'll want me around, wi' my knowledge o' such things!
But they all think I'm sick, so they'll never believe I'm behind it. Hahaha!
We'll see what they have to say about that!
Maybe you're just a nasty person.
Bah! Ye can't even think of a reason why I'd want to poison the crew, so don't bother me with yer accusations.
I don't know your reason.
Ithoi admits poisoning you all and faking the curse.
If Ithoi's been afflicted by the curse as badly as I have, he might be half out of his mind with pain. I'm sure he doesn't know what he's saying.
Have you solved the curse yet?
That can't be right - he looks as sick as the rest of us. Maybe he's delerious and doesn't know what he's saying.
He's had a lot to worry about, with losing his place on the crew, and now he's sick from the curse too. He must have gone mad and started babbling.
Ithoi admits he poisoned the crew! He's faked this whole curse!
That can't be! Ithoi's sick, an' he may be babbling madness from his fevered brain. Ye'll have to prove he's not really sick.
What d'ye want now?
I know you've faked the curse.
The Corsairs all think I'm sick too, even though I never ate the food. An' ye'll never make me prove that I'm healthy - I ain't gettin' up! So they'll keep believing in the curse.
I bet I can prove you're well enough to get up.
Ye'll never make me get up! I ain't afraid of cold, nor of wet, nor of anythin' ye can do in here.
I'll be back.
Um... nothing, really.
Maybe I should try to get more information out of him before trying to make his hut catch fire.
Well, I guess that proves he's well enough to get up! And apparently he knows some magic too.
I saw you running around! You're not sick!
So long as that old fool, Tock, believes it's a curse, I've nothing to fear from ye flapping yer mouth.
We'll see what the Captain has to say about that.
Can you tell me what's going on now?
Ithoi's faked the curse. I've seen him running around, healthy.
Make sure he gets what's coming to him. No-one poisons my crew!
So what's going on now?
It sounds like there isn't a curse after all! Maybe I'll recover soon from whatever he did to me.
What's happening now?
Give him what he deserves!
So what's happening now?
I've seen Ithoi running around. He's not sick at all.
Arrr! So he was never sick at all! An' here's me been feeling sorry for him. A trickster he be indeed! Kill him fer me.
Why don't you kill him yourself?
A captain shouldn't leave his ship in a time of crisis. Rule of the sea, that is. Even if the crisis ain't exactly on the ship.
I don't believe in capital punishment.
I do.
Ithoi faked the curse, and I've killed him.
You think you know a guy, and then he does a thing like this! Oh well, I hope I recover soon from whatever he did to me.
Not much.
Who'd have thought Ithoi would do such a thing? I guess if there isn't really a curse, I'll get better soon. In fact I feel better already.
I really didn't think he was like that. Still, if there isn't really a curse, I suppose we'll just get better from whatever he did to us. I don't feel so bad now.
I've killed Ithoi for poisoning your crew.
Thank ye fer dealing with that serpent. I suppose the rest of my crew will feel better now ye've proven there be no curse on them.
Most of them deleterious effects probably be psychosomatic anyway, arrr!
Anyways, ye've been a mighty help, young. Ye be brave in the heart, strong in the arm and full in the bowels, an' I be grateful to ye.
Tell ye what, I'll have a word with Yusuf, in the bank. Ye've earned the right to use his services. An' thanks again, very much.

characters.name: Arsen the Thief
characters.description: Adult male, French-accented English, bumbling and defensive tone. An incompetent thief who is both bad at his job and morally questionable, making excuses for his blunders with nervous deflection.

characters.name: Cabin Boy Colin
characters.description: Young male, eager British accent, earnest and naive tone. A junior sailor with romantic notions and gullible nature, enthusiastic despite his inexperience and prone to misinterpreting situations.

characters.name: Captain Tock
characters.description: Middle-aged male, hearty pirate accent, commanding and theatrical tone. A dashing corsair leader who speaks with nautical flair and surprising wit, using pirate vernacular with confident authority.

characters.name: Chief Tess
characters.description: Adult female, deep gravelly voice, authoritative and strategic tone. An ogre chieftain with ambitions of expansion, speaking with the measured confidence of a seasoned leader.

characters.name: Gnocci the Cook
characters.description: Adult male, cheerful British working-class accent, good-natured and bumbling tone. A ship's cook who makes easy mistakes but remains lighthearted, prone to accidental mishaps while fishing.

characters.name: Ithoi the Navigator
characters.description: Adult male, cunning pirate accent, deceptive and self-serving tone. A treacherous mage who speaks with false concern while secretly plotting, desperate to maintain his position on the crew.
